title: Considering Bob Dylan's 2020 new music, is he still Christian? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve searched the world over for the Holy Grail I climbed a mountain of swords on my bare feet You can bring it to St. Peter - you can bring it to Jerome If I had the wings of a snow white dove I’d preach the gospel, the gospel of love  A love so real - a love so true Let all of your earthly thoughts be a prayer Give me that old time religion, it’s just what I need  For thine is the kingdom, the power and the glory Go tell it on the Mountain, go tell the real story I feel the Holy Spirit inside and see the light that freedom gives And I’ll tell it and think it and speak it and breathe it And reflect it from the mountain so all souls can see it Then I’ll stand on the ocean until I start sinkin’ But I’ll know my song well before I start singin’ Dylan He seems to be on that mountain.

The answer is more complicated because I believe he does consider himself more than just Christian. He believes in both the Old Testament as well as the New Testament. He is both Jewish and Christian and probably more than just those two religious philosophies. There is an excellent book called Bob Dylan “A Spritual Life”. That shows his life long spiritual quest all through his music from the very beginning.

Bob Dylan is Bob Dylan….. he may or may not be Christian, the question is really kind of irrelevant…. Bob Dylan is a singer, songwriter, and performer… as he himself famously said “I am just a song and dance man”…….
Here is an article about it: Bob Dylan: Is He or Isn’t He?
